item.title: 飙升的价格让澳大利亚黄金持有者期待大肆挥霍
item.description: 受贵金属今年创下历史新高的影响，澳大利亚黄金行业预计将掀起一波交易热潮，由于勘探工作滞后，小型矿商将成为交易目标。【原文：Australia’s gold industry — buoyed by the precious metal’s record—setting run this year — is anticipating a wave of deal-making, with smaller miners being targeted as exploration lags.】

item.title: 恒大清算人开始对普华永道提起法律诉讼
item.description: 中国恒大集团的清算人已启动针对普华永道会计师事务所的法庭诉讼程序，这是为从该地产巨头收回至少一部分债权人投资而采取的又一法律步骤。【原文：China Evergrande Group’s liquidators have launched court proceedings against PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, another legal step to recover at least a fraction of creditors’ investments from the property giant.】

item.title: 市场持续动荡，日元兑美元跌幅扩大
item.description: 日本央行上周加息后，日本市场持续动荡，日元兑美元汇率周三跌幅扩大。【原文：The yen extends its loss against the dollar on Wednesday as volatility in Japan’s markets continues after the Bank of Japan hiked its interest rate last week.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦美元债券在国际货币基金组织批准贷款前大涨 30
item.description: 投资者认为，巴基斯坦美元债券的反弹需要政府当局坚持国际货币基金组织提出的经济改革路线，以扩大涨幅。【原文：The rally in Pakistani dollar bonds needs authorities to stay on the path of economic reforms proposed by the International Monetary Fund to extend gains, according to investors.】

item.title: 在亚洲股市暴跌期间，高盛寻求在韩国和印度获得收益
item.description: 高盛资产管理公司（Goldman Sachs Asset Management）认为，在周一全球股市大幅下挫之后，韩国和印度将出现极具吸引力的机会。【原文：Goldman Sachs Asset Management sees attractive opportunities in South Korea and India after Monday’s savage selloff in global equities.】

item.title: 高盛称日本对冲基金单日业绩最佳
item.description: 据高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Japan-focused hedge funds erased their losses from Monday’s trading turmoil, posting their best ever single day performance, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 日本第二季度斥资 680 亿美元两度托高日元
item.description: 根据一份关于日本政府今年早些时候干预外汇市场的记录的报告，日本在 4 月至 6 月间两次介入外汇市场。【原文：Japan stepped into the foreign exchange market twice between April and June, according to a report on the government’s record intervention earlier this year.】

item.title: 外债流入再次推动林吉特交易热潮
item.description: 马来西亚林吉特的反弹吸引了全球资金购买更多的本地债券，进一步推动了本季度新兴市场表现最好的货币。【原文：The Malaysian ringgit’s rally is luring global funds to buy more local bonds, giving a further boost to emerging market’s top-performing currency this quarter.】

item.title: 日本可能出售外国证券为外汇干预提供资金
item.description: 日本持有的外国证券在 7 月份有所减少，这表明日本政府可能通过出售国债为近期的货币干预措施提供了大量资金。【原文：Japan’s holdings of foreign securities decreased in July, suggesting that the government likely financed a large portion of the recent currency intervention by selling Treasuries.】

item.title: 哈里斯副总统人选沃尔兹与中国的长期关系可能会令人尴尬
item.description: 民主党副总统候选人蒂姆-瓦尔兹（Tim Walz）与中国的关系可以追溯到几十年前，这可能有助于卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）政府对北京的态度，但也可能给北京的领导人和国内的共和党人带来麻烦。【原文：Democratic vice presidential candidate Tim Walz has connections to China dating back decades that could help inform a potential Kamala Harris administration’s approach to Beijing, but may also spell trouble with leaders in Beijing and Republicans back home.】

item.title: 日本股市崩盘史无前例，改写了历史记录
item.description: 为期三天的日本股市暴跌震撼了全球市场，其剧烈程度几乎无法形容。以下是一些数字，可以从一个侧面反映出这一波动的规模和范围。【原文：The three-day meltdown in Japan’s stocks that’s rocked global markets was so violent that it almost defies description. Here are some numbers that put the size and scope of the move in perspective.】

item.title: 拉扎德资产称中国银行和消费企业将战胜经济放缓
item.description: 在经济增长乏力的情况下，一家新兴市场股票基金坚持持有中国白色家电制造商和银行的股票，该基金击败了大多数竞争对手。【原文：An emerging-market stock fund that’s beating most rivals is sticking with shares of Chinese white goods makers and banks amid sluggish economic growth.】

item.title: 日本股市期货预示低开，市场仍处于紧张状态
item.description: 日本股市周三开盘时可能会下跌，因为尽管隔夜全球多数股市反弹，但动荡的市况仍让投资者惶惶不安。【原文：Japanese stocks may decline at the open on Wednesday as volatile market conditions leave investors on edge despite a rebound in most bourses across the globe overnight.】

item.title: 野村的 Willcox 称日本央行加息已得到证实
item.description: 野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc.【原文：The Bank of Japan’s decision to raise rates last week was appropriate, according to a senior executive at Nomura Holdings Inc.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。美股反弹，买盘涌现。哈里斯任命瓦尔兹为竞选搭档尤努斯被任命为孟加拉国临时政府首脑。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. US stocks rebound as dip buyers emerge. Harris taps Walz as her running mate. Yunus named as head of Bangladesh’s interim government. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 市场关注伊朗袭击事件，石油在风险上涨后保持稳定
item.description: 由于投资者在关注伊朗对以色列的报复性打击，石油在从全球市场的下跌中恢复后保持稳定。【原文：Oil was steady after recovering from a global market rout as investors watched for a retaliatory strike from Iran on Israel.】

item.title: 成本飙升，巴尔的摩家庭明年电费将上涨 11
item.description: 在上个月的电网拍卖中，电力供应成本飙升至历史新高，从 2025 年年中开始，巴尔的摩地区的房主可能会看到电力账单攀升 11%。【原文：Baltimore-area homeowners likely will see electric utility bills climb 11% starting mid-2025 after the cost of procuring supplies soared to an all-time high in a grid auction last month.】

item.title: 普华永道称银行准备没收更多香港楼宇
item.description: 普华永道会计师事务所（PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP）称，在香港房地产市场低迷的情况下，预计银行将对不良楼宇采取更多执法行动。【原文：Banks are expected to take more enforcement actions on distressed buildings amid Hong Kong’s property market downturn, according to PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP.】

item.title: 巨额亏损为日本银行股大幅反弹埋下伏笔
item.description: 在近期日本股市暴跌期间，银行股跌幅过大，这有可能带来超预期的复苏。【原文：The outsized drop in bank shares during the recent rout in Japanese stocks has the potential to bring an off-the-scale recovery.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将在过山车交易中继续下跌：市场综述
item.description: 继周二全球多数市场反弹后，亚洲股市又将重拾跌势。美国期货早盘下跌。【原文：Stocks in Asia are set to resume declines following a frenzy of dip buying that fueled a rebound in most markets across the globe on Tuesday. US futures fell in early trading.】

item.title: 第一量子公司将缩减巴拿马铜矿停工时间
item.description: 工会表示，第一量子矿业有限公司（First Quantum Minerals Ltd.）正在缩减其巴拿马停产铜矿的工作时间，以控制去年关闭令之后的矿场维护成本。【原文：First Quantum Minerals Ltd. is trimming working hours at its stalled copper mine in Panama in a bid to rein in the cost of preserving the site following last year’s shutdown order, the union said.】

item.title: 交易员开始兑现对美联储大幅降息的押注
item.description: 由于期货和期权市场的交易商兑现了他们对美联储今年积极降息的押注，美国国债面临进一步抛售的风险。【原文：US Treasuries are at risk of a further selloff as traders in the futures and options markets cash in on their bets for aggressive Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts this year.】

item.title: 下一页 法院驳回液化天然气许可申请后，十年公司股价暴跌
item.description: NextDecade 公司的股价暴跌达 20%，创下一年多来的最大跌幅，原因是法院裁定该公司在得克萨斯州的液化天然气出口综合设施的联邦监管许可被驳回。【原文：NextDecade Corp.’s share price tumbled as much as 20%, the biggest plunge in more than a year, after a court ruling that struck down the company’s federal regulatory permit for its liquefied natural gas export complex in Texas.】

item.title: 局势动荡，VIX 基金卷土重来，单日涨幅达 84
item.description: 对股市剧烈波动下注的 ETF 又开始流行起来；在本周的快速下跌和回升过程中，ETF 有大涨也有大跌。【原文：ETFs that place bets on severe stock-market swings are coming back into vogue — delivering big gains and losses during this week’s rapid downturn and recovery.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利称特朗普胜算上升将提振美元
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）分析师表示，即使共和党的目标是抵消美元的强势，但今年晚些时候共和党当选总统的可能性增加也会提振美元。【原文：An increased potential for a Republican president later this year stands to boost the US dollar even if the party aims to offset the currency’s strength, according to Morgan Stanley analysts.】

item.title: Airbnb 因前景疲软而暴跌，预示美国需求放缓
item.description: Airbnb 公司连续第三个季度的业绩展望令人失望，并警告说美国游客的需求放缓，这表明即使在夏季旅游旺季，旅游消费的势头也将继续减弱，因此该公司股价暴跌。【原文：Shares of Airbnb Inc. tumbled after the company gave a disappointing outlook for a third consecutive quarter and warned of slowing demand from US travelers — a sign that momentum in travel spending will continue to taper off even during the peak summer season.】

item.title: Vista 以主导私人市场为由关闭对冲基金
item.description: Vista Equity Partners 已告知投资者，在市场向私人资产发生 "结构性转变 "的背景下，该公司将关闭其对冲基金。【原文：Vista Equity Partners has told investors it’s winding down its hedge fund amid a “structural shift” in markets toward private assets.】

item.title: 对冲基金在 "可怕 "的清盘后重新投向加密货币看涨期权
item.description: 加密货币交易商在上周末经历了今年最严重的一次看涨头寸清算后，几乎立即又在期权市场上投入了乐观的赌注。【原文：Crypto traders are piling back into optimistic bets in the options market almost immediately after one of the worst liquidations of bullish positions this year over the weekend.】

item.title: 市场震荡给繁忙的夏季股票销售带来冲击
item.description: 最近的股市动荡有可能给夏季火爆的美股销售踩下刹车。【原文：The recent bout of stock-market turbulence threatens to put the brakes on what had been a brisk summer for US share sales.】

item.title: 捷蓝航空就可能的 27.5 亿美元债务交易向投资者发出邀请
item.description: 美国捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways Corp.【原文：JetBlue Airways Corp. has held talks with lenders for a potential $2.75 billion debt offering that would be backed by its loyalty program, making it the latest carrier to undertake such an deal.】
